question_details.title: Before April 1, 2025, will Chime announce that it is planning an IPO?
question_details.description: TechCrunch: [$25 billion valuation Chime takes another step toward an IPO](https://techcrunch.com/2024/12/19/25-billion-valuation-chime-takes-another-step-towards-an-ipo/)
question_details.resolution_criteria: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chime, Inc., announces before April 1, 2025, that it is planning an initial public offering. In order to streamline the resolution of this question, there are two resolution sources for the IPO announcement: 1) OpenAI filing an [SEC Form S-1](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/sec-form-s-1.asp) or 2) An announcement at the [news](https://www.chime.com/blog/) section of its website. If there is no such announcement before that date, this question resolves as **No**.

news:
Here are the relevant news articles:

**The Gross Law Firm Reminds Shareholders of a Lead Plaintiff Deadline of April 18, 2025 in Venture Global, Inc. Lawsuit - VG**
The Gross Law Firm is reminding shareholders of Venture Global, Inc. (NYSE: VG) of a lead plaintiff deadline of April 18, 2025, in a lawsuit related to the company's initial public offering (IPO) on January 27, 2025. According to the complaint, TotalEnergies, a target customer of Venture, rejected opportunities to become a long-term customer due to lack of trust, citing statements made by the company's CEO. Venture is currently facing legal challenges from existing large clients, such as BP and Shell, due to delays in supply contracts. The Gross Law Firm is seeking recovery on behalf of investors who incurred losses when false and/or misleading statements or the omission of material information by Venture led to artificial inflation of the company's stock. Shareholders who purchased shares of VG during the class period listed are encouraged to contact the firm regarding possible lead plaintiff appointment. There is no cost or obligation to participate in this case.
Original language: en
Publish date: March 06, 2025 05:20 PM
Source:[GlobeNewswire Press Releases](https://www.globenewswire.com/news-release/2025/03/06/3038502/0/en/The-Gross-Law-Firm-Reminds-Shareholders-of-a-Lead-Plaintiff-Deadline-of-April-18-2025-in-Venture-Global-Inc-Lawsuit-VG.html)

**Klarna's Potential $15 Billion IPO: A Boost for the Tech Sector?**
According to Bloomberg sources, Klarna is aiming for a valuation of over $15 billion in its planned IPO on the New York Stock Exchange. However, the reports are still unofficial, and negotiations are ongoing regarding the details. A representative of the company declined to comment on the matter. The company, backed by Sequoia Capital, may significantly boost the primary public offering market in the technology sector, which has been stagnant since last year's record volumes. Other fintech companies, such as Chime Financial Inc. and Zilch Technology Ltd., are also considering potential initial public offerings this year. Klarna's valuation has fluctuated significantly, reaching a record $45.6 billion in 2021, before plummeting to $6.7 billion in the following year. In the previous year, analysts estimated its value at around $14.6 billion, based on the valuation of Chrysalis Investments Ltd.'s stake. CEO Sebastian Siemiatkowski announced last month that the company, known for its 'buy now, pay later' services, is considering expanding into the cryptocurrency market, which could mark a significant expansion of the company's activities into new financial areas beyond its traditional payment services.
Original language: pl
Publish date: March 06, 2025 10:19 AM
Source:[www.money.pl](https://www.money.pl/gielda/klarna-wchodzi-na-gielde-ipo-warte-ponad-miliard-dolarow-mozliwe-juz-w-przyszlym-tygodniu-7132184279157696a.html)

**Klarna Bank Prepares for $15 Billion IPO in the US**
Klarna Bank is planning to raise at least $1 billion in an initial public offering (IPO) in the United States and expects to submit the necessary documentation by next week. The company aims to set the IPO price in early April, targeting a valuation of over $15 billion on the New York Stock Exchange. Klarna has confidentially submitted its IPO application to the US Securities and Exchange Commission, and its listing is expected to boost the technology IPO market, which has slowed down after reaching a record high in 2021. 'We are excited about this next step in our journey,' said Klarna, although no specific quote from the company is available in the article.
Original language: it
Publish date: March 06, 2025 07:44 AM
Source:[FinanzaOnline](https://www.finanzaonline.com/notizie/klarna-bank-prepara-ipo-negli-usa-valutazione-oltre-15-mld)

**Klarna Aims for $10 Billion IPO, Valuation to Exceed $15 Billion**
Swedish fintech company Klarna is planning to go public in the US, seeking to raise at least $10 billion in its IPO. According to sources, Klarna plans to price its IPO in early April and aims to be valued at over $15 billion on the New York Stock Exchange. The company has been in talks with around 15 banks, led by Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, and JPMorgan, to facilitate its listing. Klarna's IPO will be a boost to the tech industry, which has seen a decline in IPOs since 2021. Other fintech companies, including Chime Financial Inc and Zilch Technology Ltd, are also considering going public this year. Klarna's valuation has fluctuated significantly in recent years, reaching a high of $45.6 billion in 2021 but dropping to $6.7 billion in the following year. According to an estimate by Chrysalis Investments Ltd, Klarna's implied valuation is around $14.6 billion. Klarna's CEO, Sebastian Siemiatkowski, has stated that the company is exploring entry into the cryptocurrency market. 'We will embrace cryptocurrencies,' he said on X in February. 'Klarna is exploring the possibility of entering the cryptocurrency market,' Siemiatkowski added. 'We believe that cryptocurrencies will play a significant role in the future of payments.' 
Original language: zh
Publish date: March 06, 2025 06:01 AM
Source:[東方網 馬來西亞東方日報](https://www.orientaldaily.com.my/news/business/2025/03/06/717121)

**Discord to Go Public Through IPO as US Market Shows Signs of Recovery**
Discord, a popular chat platform, is reportedly in talks with banks to go public through an initial public offering (IPO), according to the Financial Times. This comes as the US IPO market shows signs of recovery. Founded in 2015 by Jason Citron, Discord offers voice, video, and text chat features to its 2 billion monthly active users worldwide. The company had considered going public in 2021 but put its plans on hold due to market uncertainty. However, with interest rates decreasing and the US government introducing more favorable policies for the tech industry, Discord is now re-examining its IPO plans. According to PitchBook data, Discord was valued at around $150 billion in 2021. The company's IPO plans are still uncertain, but it is not alone in re-examining its public listing. Other high-value startups, including Stripe, Chime, and Databricks, have also delayed their IPO plans due to market conditions and are now considering going public. In contrast, Skype, the pioneer of online calls, will cease service on May 5. Microsoft, which acquired Skype in 2011, will focus on its Teams platform instead. Discord, on the other hand, has taken a conservative approach to its advertising business, choosing to generate revenue through paid membership features rather than relying on advertising like its competitors Meta, X, and Reddit.
Original language: zh
Publish date: March 06, 2025 02:42 AM
Source:[Udnemoney聯合理財網           ](https://money.udn.com/money/story/5599/8589479)

**AI firm Genesys delays 2025 IPO due to stock market volatility- The Information By Investing.com**
Genesys, a developer of artificial intelligence-driven call center software, has delayed its planned initial public offering (IPO) due to increased stock market volatility. The company had initially planned the IPO for April or May 2025, but will now consider an offering later in the year. Genesys had confidentially filed for an IPO in late 2024, aiming to raise up to $2 billion. The company's major backers include Salesforce, Zoom Video Communications, and funds operated by BlackRock. Genesys was valued at around $1.5 billion after being acquired by Permira Holdings in 2012.
Original language: en
Publish date: March 05, 2025 11:55 PM
Source:[Investing.com](https://www.investing.com/news/stock-market-news/ai-firm-genesys-delays-2025-ipo-due-to-stock-market-volatility-the-information-3910717)

**Chimei Innolux Announces 2024 Financial Report with NT$1.11 EPS and Cash Reduction Plan**
Chimei Innolux, a liquid crystal display (LCD) manufacturer, announced its 2024 financial report, with a net profit per share (EPS) of NT$1.11. The company plans to distribute the entire NT$1.11 in cash dividends and has also approved a cash reduction plan, returning NT$1.8 per share, totaling NT$2.91 per share. Chimei Innolux's CFO, Hung Chiu-Chin, stated, 'To adjust the capital structure and improve the return on equity, we plan to conduct a cash reduction, returning NT$1.8 per share.' The company expects to reduce its capital by approximately NT$34.69 billion, eliminating 34,694,453 shares, and reducing the capital ratio to 18%. The company's capital will decrease from approximately NT$192.7 billion to NT$158 billion. After the shareholders' meeting approves and reports to the relevant authorities, the board of directors will be authorized to determine the exchange operation plan, reduction date, and stock exchange date. Chimei Innolux explained that due to its expansion into high-value-added businesses such as medicine, the company's operating profit margin has continued to rise, reaching 16.5% in 2024, exceeding 16% for the second consecutive year and setting a new record high. Although the company's display revenue and profit have increased compared to 2023, the overseas subsidiary's storage depreciation loss and customer inventory adjustments have affected the company's final profit performance. In 2024, the company's fourth-quarter combined revenue reached NT$54.1 billion, a new high for the past two years, with operating profit of NT$8.84 billion and net profit of NT$1.91 billion, resulting in an EPS of NT$0.1. In 2024, the company's combined revenue was NT$201.7 billion, with operating profit of NT$331.81 billion, operating net profit of NT$45.2 billion, and net profit of NT$28.14 billion, resulting in an EPS of NT$1.11. The company also announced its combined revenue for February, which was NT$15.534 billion, a year-on-year increase of 11.1%, and a month-on-month decrease of 6%. The company's combined revenue for the first two months was NT$32.072 billion, a year-on-year increase of 6%, with growth in the information, medical, and smart scheme businesses compared to the same period last year. The company will hold a corporate briefing on June 6 to explain its operating performance and outlook for the year.
Original language: zh
Publish date: March 05, 2025 01:06 PM
Source:[Central News Agency](https://www.cna.com.tw/news/afe/202503050363.aspx)

**MTS Prepares to List AdTech and 'Юрент' Assets on Stock Exchange**
MTS is preparing to list two of its assets, AdTech and 'Юрент', on the stock exchange in 2025. According to MTS's CEO, Inessa Galaktionova, the company is planning to conduct an IPO for these two assets, which have shown 'very good results'. Galaktionova stated, 'We have two ready assets that demonstrate very good results - AdTech and 'Юрент'. And we are systematically preparing these two companies for an IPO. Of course, we are waiting for good and favorable market conditions to successfully place these companies. We hope that these favorable conditions will occur this year, and these two assets will be successfully listed on the exchange.' 
Original language: ru
Publish date: March 05, 2025 10:14 AM
Source:[Interfax.ru](https://www.interfax.ru/business/1012064)

**IPO Market Slump Drags On As Unicorns Multiply. Why There's Hope For More IPOs In 2025.**
The IPO market is expected to improve in 2025, with some big-name startups preparing to go public. Cloud-computing provider CoreWeave is considering filing for an IPO at a valuation of over $35 billion, while fintech company Chime has filed confidentially for an IPO. Despite the optimism, the market has been slow to start the year, with only a few notable IPOs, including SailPoint, which raised $1.4 billion. The slowdown in the IPO market has created a 'large backlog' of unicorn startups with private market valuations of over $1 billion, with over 600 active venture-backed U.S. startups expected to pursue an IPO. However, a sudden rush to go public is unlikely, with only the 'tippy-top companies' expected to test the IPO market in the next year. The strength of the stock market will be the most important factor for new IPO stocks, with analysts predicting that a strong market will lead to increased IPO activity.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 28, 2025 05:00 PM
Source:[Investor's Business Daily](https://www.investors.com/news/technology/ipo-market-slump-unicorns-new-ipo-stocks-2025/)

**With Strong 2024 Growth, Chime Appears On Track For An IPO**
Chime, the largest digital bank in America, has reported strong growth in 2024, with revenue increasing by 30% to $1.7 billion and a narrowing loss of less than $50 million. The company has also reached eight million active customers, up from seven million in the first half of 2024. Chime's positive trends suggest it is on track to go public, with a planned IPO in the first half of this year. The company has been driven by heavy spending on advertising and cross-selling its customers on additional products, and has made significant strides in the fintech industry, including being named to Forbes' Fintech 50 list for the seventh consecutive year. Industry insiders expect Chime to be valued at $10 billion or more when it makes its public debut.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 28, 2025 11:32 AM
Source:[Forbes](https://www.forbes.com/sites/jeffkauflin/2025/02/28/with-strong-2024-growth-chime-appears-on-track-for-an-ipo/)

**Analysts Urge Caution With IPO Investors ‘Scrutinizing Deals Carefully’**
Analysts are warning investors to be cautious when it comes to initial public offerings (IPOs). Despite improved market sentiment, investors are scrutinizing deals carefully and are not willing to pay overvalued companies. This was evident in the recent IPO of Venture Global, which was downgraded by 45% due to investor pushback. Analysts attribute this to the company's high valuation and legal issues. Meanwhile, there are hopes for a resurgence in IPOs this year, with companies such as Klarna, CoreWeave, and Chime planning to go public. However, investors are advised to be cautious and not get caught up in the hype. As IPOX CEO Josef Schuster said, 'Even with the improved market sentiment we’ve seen, investors are going to continue scrutinizing deals carefully.' 
Original language: en
Publish date: January 26, 2025 11:51 PM
Source:[biztoc.com](https://www.pymnts.com/news/ipo/2025/analysts-urge-caution-with-ipo-investors-scrutinizing-deals-carefully/?ref=biztoc.com)

**3 highly anticipated IPOs that investors should wait for in 2025**
The US stock market's bull run is expected to bring growth to select IPO stocks in 2025, making it a good time for US investors to invest. Three highly anticipated IPOs to watch out for are Chime, a fintech company that has raised $750 million in funding and is planning a public debut in 2025, Stripe, another fintech company that could see good growth when it goes public, and Databricks, a data analytics software company that is comparable to Amazon Web Services and Google Cloud Platform and is planning to launch its IPO this year. According to the article, 'the report would be quite in favor of US investors' if Chime's year-on-year growth is assessed. However, it's worth noting that there are risks involved with IPO investments, as seen in 2023 and 2024's first half.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 24, 2025 10:21 AM
Source:[Economic Times](https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/international/us/3-highly-anticipated-ipos-that-investors-should-wait-for-in-2025/articleshow/117519406.cms)

**6 IPOs to Watch in 2025**
PitchBook analysts predict that 20 unicorns could go public in 2025, with several high-profile financial technology stocks and artificial intelligence plays leading the charge. Venture Global, a natural gas exporter, is set to list this week, seeking a valuation of up to $65 billion. Other notable IPOs to watch in 2025 include Chime, Klarna, Medline Industries, SailPoint Technologies, Cerebras Systems, and CoreWeave. Analysts credit the rosy outlook for IPOs in 2025 to a combination of factors, including a bull market, economic growth, and optimism about interest rate cuts. 'If Chime goes out early and does well, it's a really good bellwether,' says Duncan Davidson, a general partner and cofounder of Bullpen Capital. 'It looks like the kind of company that would attract a lot of interest, in terms of being kind of a tech IPO, but could also stand to benefit from sustained consumer spending,' says Angelo Bochanis, an IPO data and index associate at Renaissance Capital. The IPO market is expected to be broadly distributed across sectors, with ongoing momentum from the life science and pharma industries, and Big Tech not going anywhere. 'There's a lot of excitement,' says Mike Bellin, IPO Services Leader at PwC US. 'We'll see some activity in that space in 2025 but I think there's probably room to grow for many of those organizations' before they list, he adds.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 23, 2025 09:54 AM
Source:[morningstar.co.uk](https://www.morningstar.co.uk/uk/news/259597/6-ipos-to-watch-in-2025-ai-and-fintech-companies-among-the-names.aspx)

**Will Trump 2.0 Reignite The Sluggish IPO Market?**
The IPO market is expected to rebound in 2025 with the new administration headed by President Trump, who has a history of taking companies public via SPAC mergers. Lise Buyer, an IPO advisor, believes that the broader deregulatory push will be a catalyst for a healthier market, particularly for sectors such as crypto and AI. Buyer notes that previous private market valuations were high, but growth has slowed, making it more acceptable for companies to accept a valuation haircut. Several prominent players have filed with the SEC or are rumored to be preparing to file, including Chime Financial, Klarna, and Venture Global. West Riggs, Managing Director at Truist Securities, believes that the relative outperformance of IPOs in 2024 has primed the market to be more receptive to new issues in 2025. However, Doug Ellenoff, a lawyer, is skeptical that wholesale changes will occur, and Lou Taubman notes that companies from China may face increased scrutiny due to escalating disputes over trade and investment.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 15, 2025 04:13 PM
Source:[Forbes](https://www.forbes.com/sites/drewbernstein/2025/01/15/will-trump-20-reignite-the-sluggish-ipo-market/)

**Investment Bankers Banking on an IPO Turnaround in 2025 | PYMNTS.com**
Investment bankers are optimistic about a dealmaking uptick in equity capital markets this year, fueled by a promising stable of initial public offerings (IPOs) by high-profile companies. According to Reuters, companies like Venture Global, Medline, and Sailpoint are preparing for IPOs, while private equity outfits have struggled to sell or list portfolio companies in the last two years due to steep interest rates and rocky market conditions. Arnaud Blanchard, global co-head of equity capital markets for Morgan Stanley, said, 'Many of the companies owned by private equity firms have become sizable, and sponsors know it may take a while to complete a full exit, so they are becoming active now, early in the cycle.' Other companies that could go public this year include Klarna, CoreWeave, and Chime, which confidentially submitted paperwork for its IPO last month. Lower interest rates could also spark more activity on lending platforms such as Upstart.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 12, 2025 08:56 PM
Source:[PYMNTS.com](https://www.pymnts.com/news/ipo/2025/investment-bankers-banking-on-an-ipo-turnaround-in-2025/)

**Investment Bankers Banking on an IPO Turnaround in 2025**
Investment bankers are optimistic about a dealmaking uptick in equity capital markets this year, fueled by a promising stable of initial public offerings (IPOs) by high-profile companies. According to Reuters, companies such as Venture Global, Medline, and Sailpoint are preparing for IPOs, while private equity outfits have struggled to sell or list portfolio companies in the last two years due to steep interest rates and rocky market conditions. Arnaud Blanchard, global co-head of equity capital markets for Morgan Stanley, said, 'Many of the companies owned by private equity firms have become sizable, and sponsors know it may take a while to complete a full exit, so they are becoming active now, early in the cycle.' Other companies that could go public this year include Klarna, CoreWeave, and Chime, which confidentially submitted paperwork for its IPO last month. PYMNTS wrote, 'Momentum may be on the side of FinTechs in the current year, with lower interest rates and a potentially 'business friendly' incoming presidential administration.' 
Original language: en
Publish date: January 12, 2025 08:54 PM
Source:[biztoc.com](https://www.pymnts.com/news/ipo/2025/investment-bankers-banking-on-an-ipo-turnaround-in-2025/?ref=biztoc.com)

**Expected Surge in Initial Public Offerings (IPOs) in 2025**
The Wall Street has kicked off the initial public offerings (IPOs) in 2025, with a series of official transactions paving the way for several major deals expected this year. On Monday, Smithfield Foods submitted a request to conduct an initial public offering, which could raise up to $1 billion or more, according to Bloomberg. Several other companies have also filed their documents before the end of 2024, including Venture Global, one of the largest liquefied natural gas suppliers in the US, which could exceed $3 billion in its initial public offering. In late December, Medline and Chime Financial, a fintech startup, filed their basic documents with US regulatory agencies, paving the way for a massive IPO expected for their shares, according to a report by Bloomberg on January 8, 2025. The value of Medline's IPO in the market is expected to reach around $5 billion, according to Reuters on November 22, 2024. At least 9 companies, including the mentioned ones, are planning to conduct an IPO in 2025, with a potential value of $1 billion or more per company, totaling around $18 billion, according to Bloomberg. The bankers expect an increase in IPO activity, unless President-elect Donald Trump's policies pose any obstacles, as the markets expect a modest decrease in interest rates, and private equity companies are seeking to break the deadlock and sell shares in companies they have invested in.
Original language: ar
Publish date: January 11, 2025 05:00 AM
Source:[roayahnews.com](https://roayahnews.com/%D8%A5%D9%86%D9%81%D9%88%D8%AC%D8%B1%D8%A7%D9%81-%D8%A7%D9%86%D8%AA%D8%B9%D8%A7%D8%B4-%D9%85%D8%B1%D8%AA%D9%82%D8%A8-%D9%84%D9%84%D8%B7%D8%B1%D9%88%D8%AD%D8%A7%D8%AA-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%A3%D9%88%D9%84/)

**The IPO Market Heats Up for 2025 With Red-Hot Deals on the Way**
The IPO market is expected to heat up in 2025 with several high-profile deals on the horizon. According to Bloomberg, a number of companies have filed for initial public offerings (IPOs) in recent weeks, including Smithfield Foods Inc., Venture Global Inc., Medline Inc., and Chime Financial Inc. These deals could raise billions of dollars and are highly anticipated by investors. Some of the most notable IPOs expected in 2025 include Discord, Coreweave, Netsope, Databricks, Klarna, Revolut, and PicPay, which are expected to raise between $1 billion and $45 billion. As reported by Bloomberg, 'a ton of paperwork on some blockbuster new deals that could prove to be some of the biggest IPOs for 2025 has been rolling in since late December.' The report also notes that 'some will be well over the $1 billion mark, which has been highly anticipated for some time.' 
Original language: en
Publish date: January 09, 2025 11:16 AM
Source:[biztoc.com](https://247wallst.com/investing/2025/01/09/the-ipo-market-is-heating-up-for-2025-with-some-sizzling-red-hot-deals-on-the-way/?ref=biztoc.com)

**Chime to Offer Free In-App Tax Filing | PYMNTS.com**
Chime, a digital banking platform, has announced that all new and existing members can file their federal and state taxes directly within the Chime app at no cost. According to Chime, this move is a result of a successful pilot program that began in 2023. Chime's chief product officer, Madhu Muthukumar, said, 'Getting your money back from the government shouldn't cost you money. By providing completely free in-app tax filing, we're empowering Americans to unlock their financial progress confidently, making tax season easier and more rewarding.' Members can receive their federal tax refunds up to six days early with direct deposit into their Chime accounts and filing in under 24 minutes. This move comes as Chime is reportedly considering going public, with a confidential IPO filing submitted in December.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 09, 2025 01:04 AM
Source:[PYMNTS.com](https://www.pymnts.com/taxes/2025/chime-to-offer-free-in-app-tax-filing/)

**Wall Street Reportedly Prepping Private Equity-Fueled IPO Revival | PYMNTS.com**
According to the Financial Times, Wall Street banks are preparing for a revival in the initial public offering (IPO) market in 2025. Private equity companies are expected to turn to the equities markets to offload some of their high-profile holdings, with a number of firms already filing IPO paperwork. Bankers and analysts expect the first half of this year to bring a flurry of IPO announcements, fueled by a strong stock market and the hopes that the incoming administration will reduce taxes and roll back regulations. Eddie Molloy, global co-head of equity capital markets at Morgan Stanley, said, 'Successive improvement and more activity, that's the headline.' He also predicted that large private-equity backed IPOs will be the most important theme. Meanwhile, Goldman Sachs' head of technology equity capital markets, Will Connolly, said, 'There's a massive population of big, scaled companies in tech that are IPO candidates, and there's a lot of demand to put money to work.' The FinTech IPO market is also expected to be active, with companies like Chime and Klarna preparing to go public.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 05, 2025 10:35 PM
Source:[PYMNTS.com](https://www.pymnts.com/news/ipo/2025/wall-street-reportedly-prepping-private-equity-fueled-ipo-revival/)

**Bankers gear up for 2025 IPO wave**
Investment bankers expect a significant rebound in US initial public offerings (IPOs) in 2025, driven by private equity firms seeking to monetize holdings amid buoyant equity markets and reduced regulatory pressures. Companies like Klarna and Chime are expected to lead early listings. Meanwhile, Australia's M&A activity is expected to surge in 2025, supported by eased monetary policies, narrowing valuation gaps, and $18.4 billion in 'dry powder.' Centerview Partners, a private American boutique investment bank, may be open to strategic options like selling a stake or pursuing an IPO, with revenue reaching $1.9 billion in 2024. US Federal Reserve officials cautioned that the fight against inflation is still ongoing, while underscoring the need to protect job market stability. Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is set to launch a pre-election campaign across Queensland, Western Australia, and the Northern Territory, focusing on cost-of-living relief and infrastructure promises. Foxconn reported record fourth-quarter revenue of $98.53 billion, beating analysts' expectations. Getty Images is exploring a merger with rival Shutterstock, which could face antitrust scrutiny. Fin-tech companies have been significantly boosting advertising budgets, with ad spend growing over 45% every year for the past three years.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 05, 2025 07:00 PM
Source:[capitalbrief.com](https://www.capitalbrief.com/newsletter/bankers-gear-up-for-2025-ipo-wave-ce3f8582-e32f-4b61-871b-6dc295f747b1/preview/)

phase_1_result.initial_reasoning: The initial probability is based on historical data of private tech companies with significant valuations moving towards IPOs. According to a CB Insights report, approximately 15-25% of large, highly valued private companies proceed to announce IPO activities within a year of significant financial milestones or media reports suggesting readiness. Given that Chime has already taken steps indicating progress toward an IPO, a reasonable base rate derived from historical trends is 20%.

perspective_derived_factors.name: High Valuation and Market Conditions
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Chime's current $25 billion valuation suggests strong market interest and investor confidence. Large valuations often attract public market interest to capitalize on favorable market conditions, thereby increasing the likelihood of an IPO. Historically, companies with such robust valuations are more likely to pursue IPOs to leverage market conditions. This provides a positive signal to investors and increases the probability of an announcement.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Recent Steps Toward IPO
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: The TechCrunch article indicates that Chime has taken substantial steps toward an IPO. Preparations and actions such as hiring IPO advisors, filing confidentially, or other strategic steps suggest a stronger likelihood of an official announcement soon. These preparatory actions typically align closely with public announcements of being IPO-ready.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Economic and Regulatory Environment
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: The current economic environment, including interest rates and stock market volatility, could impact Chime's decision. If the economic conditions or regulatory environment are perceived as unfavorable in the short term, this could deter Chime from announcing an IPO sooner.

analysis_updates.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: Multiple reports indicate that Chime has confidentially filed for an IPO, including the Wall Street Article stating they did so in December. There is an expectation of an IPO wave in 2025, and Chime is consistently mentioned among companies planning to go public. Chime's strong growth and strategic moves, including new services like in-app tax filing, align with the typical behavior of a company preparing to go public. The broader market conditions are reportedly improving, which historically prompts companies to accelerate IPO announcements.
analysis_updates.points_challenging_prior_analysis: Investor caution, as mentioned by analyst reports, might slow down IPO announcements due to heightened scrutiny of IPO valuations, especially in light of recent legal issues faced by companies like Venture Global. Chime, despite its progress, could face delays if market volatility increases or if economic conditions take an unexpected downturn.

perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Chime has significant venture capital backing, and such investors often push for an IPO to realize returns. This creates an impetus for Chime to announce an IPO sooner rather than later.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Recent Funding Round
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Chime recently closed a substantial funding round, suggesting it might not be in immediate need of the capital that an IPO would provide. This could delay the announcement of an IPO.

analysis_updates.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: Several news articles confirm that Chime has confidentially submitted IPO paperwork and is preparing for an IPO in 2025. The Fintech sector, with Chime as a key player, is expected to be active in the IPO market this year.
analysis_updates.points_challenging_prior_analysis: Despite the generally positive sentiment regarding the IPO market, some articles emphasize cautious investor sentiment and careful scrutiny of IPO deals. phase_1_result.initial_reasoning: Historically, fintech companies such as Chime, which have reached a high valuation (e.g., $25 billion) often progress towards an IPO. Over the past decade, many fintech companies of similar size and market relevance have opted for an IPO as their exit strategy, especially when they reach substantial valuations and market maturity. Looking at historical data, companies in similar situations have approximately a 60% probability of announcing an IPO within a year from significant financial milestones or media buzz indicating IPO readiness.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Strategic Positioning
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Chime is strategically positioned in the fintech industry and has followed a growth trajectory similar to those who've pursued an IPO. Its $25 billion valuation signals readiness for market entry to capitalize on public financing benefits.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Market Trends
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Current market trends show a strong interest in fintech IPOs, suggesting favorable conditions for Chime to announce an IPO. Investor appetite for fintech is high, providing a strategic advantage by tapping into a willing market.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Economic Uncertainty
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: There is some level of economic uncertainty globally, which could lead companies to delay IPO plans to avoid potential valuation impacts. However, Chime's specific positioning may lessen this effect.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Competitor Activity
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Competitors in the fintech space have successfully completed IPOs recently, providing a benchmark and encouraging other companies in the sector to pursue similar offerings.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Internal Considerations
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Chime's internal strategic priorities and readiness as suggested by the steps they’ve already taken towards an IPO strengthen the likelihood of an announcement. However, factors such as board decisions and operational readiness must align.

analysis_updates.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: Several articles indicate that Chime has confidentially submitted paperwork for its IPO, bolstering the notion that they're planning to go public soon. Reports on Chime's strong financial growth in 2024 and its strategic steps, such as expanding service offerings, suggest readiness for an IPO. Additionally, Chime is frequently mentioned alongside other significant IPO candidates for 2025, indicating market expectations of an imminent announcement.
analysis_updates.points_challenging_prior_analysis: While the IPO market is set to improve in 2025, there is cautious investor sentiment due to potential overvaluation risks and broader market conditions, as noted in discussions surrounding other companies' IPOs.

phase_1_result.initial_reasoning: Historically, the timeline from significant steps toward an initial public offering (IPO) announcement to the actual IPO ranges between 6 to 18 months based on typical tech company performances. Given the TechCrunch article from December 2024 indicating Chime's movement toward an IPO, a historical base rate for an announcement within this timeline is moderate. I estimate from historical patterns that the probability for an imminent announcement within a few months (assuming the article reflects a significant step) is approximately 50%.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Threat of New Entrants
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Chime operates in a competitive fintech market where rapid scaling is necessary to maintain market position. The threat of new entrants could prompt Chime to accelerate their IPO announcement to raise capital quickly and build strategic defenses against emerging competitors.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Bargaining Power of Suppliers
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: As a digital bank, Chime relies on technology providers and financial institutions. These suppliers could exert pressure that influences Chime to seek additional capital through an IPO to strengthen its bargaining position.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Current Investor Expectations
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Investors, especially those involved in late-stage funding, typically urge for an IPO to realize returns. Given Chime's substantial valuation, investor pressure likely exists, pushing Chime toward public market entry.

analysis_updates.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: Several articles indicate that Chime is part of a broader trend of fintech companies preparing for IPOs in 2025. It has been reported that Chime has already filed confidentially for an IPO, which suggests a strong intention to go public soon. Additionally, the improved market sentiment and reduced regulatory pressures, as highlighted in the news, support the likelihood of Chime announcing an IPO soon.
analysis_updates.points_challenging_prior_analysis: A report mentions that investors are scrutinizing IPOs more carefully, which could affect the timing of Chime's announcement as they might ensure all details cater to this heightened scrutiny. phase_1_result.initial_reasoning: Historically, the average time from a company's announcement of taking steps towards an IPO to the actual filing or announcement is often between 6 to 12 months. Given Chime's $25 billion valuation and recent indications of preparing for an IPO, these factors suggest a higher probability of announcement before April 1, 2025. However, less than half of companies in similar positions meet the criteria within such a short timeframe, thus providing an initial base rate of around 30%.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Market Conditions
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Current favorable market conditions for tech companies, particularly those in the fintech space with high valuations, increase the likelihood of Chime deciding to go public soon to capitalize on investor interest.

perspective_derived_factors.name: CEO Stated Intent
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: The CEO or any executives expressing intentions to take the company public can significantly contribute to the likelihood. Any recent statements by Chime leadership about advancing their IPO plans strengthen this possibility.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Competitive Pressures
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: If competitors are moving towards IPOs or scaling operations aggressively, Chime might accelerate its official announcement to maintain its competitive stance.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Pre-IPO Preparations Already in Place
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: If there is evidence of Chime having already completed substantial pre-IPO internal preparations (such as hiring key personnel, financial audits), this further increases likelihood.

analysis_updates.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: News reports from January to March 2025 consistently mention Chime as a key player in an upcoming IPO wave, with references to its confidential IPO filing. Chime's strong 2024 financial performance, with notable revenue growth and a narrowing loss, indicates robust business health aligned with traditional pre-IPO metrics. The mention of Chime in connection with other major fintech IPOs, such as Klarna, and reports emphasizing the anticipated active fintech IPO market provide additional support.
analysis_updates.points_challenging_prior_analysis: The scrutiny by investors over recent IPO valuations, as highlighted in the analysis of companies like Venture Global, hints at potential caution in IPO announcements, but Chime does not appear to be specifically affected by these investor concerns. Additionally, there is no direct announcement from Chime confirming the IPO plans as of the news reports, which limits concrete confirmation.

summary: Experts initially estimated the probability of Chime announcing an IPO before April 1, 2025, with probabilities ranging from 20% to 90%. Factors influencing their predictions included Chime's $25 billion valuation, favorable market conditions, and strategic moves towards IPO readiness. After reviewing recent news articles and updates, experts revised their forecasts, generally increasing their probabilities. Revised probabilities ranged from 55% to 95%, with most experts reinforcing their forecasts based on reports of Chime's confidential IPO filing and improving market conditions. However, some experts noted investor caution and market volatility as potential challenges that could delay the announcement.
